result.rationale: The species is only known from the upper Sipaliwini river basin, Suriname. It has a restricted distribution with an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 1,653 km<sup>2</sup>. There is only one location based on the threat of deforestation, and this is leading to a continuing decline in habitat. Therefore, this species is assessed as Endangered.
result.geographicrange: The species is only known from the upper Sipaliwini river basin in Suriname (Boeseman 1968).
result.population: No population assessments are known for this species.
result.habitat: All specimens were collected in or near rapids (Boeseman 1968).
result.threats: The upper Sipaliwini river basin is affected by deforestation as evidenced in satellite photographs. The overall area where this species is distributed is subject to gold and bauxite mining (J.W. Armbruster pers. comm. 2021).
result.conservationmeasures: The upper Sipaliwini river flows through the Sipaliwini Savana Nature Reserve in Suriname.
result.usetrade: No uses are known for this species.
